intro: Lavatera trimestris, commonly known as the three-week mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are five-petaled and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lavatera trimestris is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
